title: Cut Slate
provenance_text:
Raoul Ubac [1910-1985], Paris, France; Aimé Maeght, Paris, France, until January 1959 [1]; purchased by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1958 [2].

Notes:
[1]. The sculpture was exhibited (no. 447, illustrated in catalogue, plate 43) in "The 1958 Pittsburgh Bicentennial International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting and Sculpture" held at Carnegie Institute, December 1958 - February 1959. It was lent by Aimé Maeght, Paris, France. See also note [2] below. 
[2]. The sculpture was purchased by Carnegie Institute from the International. It was accessioned on December 17, 1958. Payment was sent to Aimé Maeght (via the Institute's French agent) on January 9, 1959.
